title: Basics of Child Development and Wellbeing
headline: Learn how to care for children and cultivate their development and wellbeing in this free online childcare course.
description: ‘Child development’ encompasses the journey from dependence at birth to independence in adulthood. It refers to physical and mental growth and other areas of development from infancy to maturity. This course explores theories of child development and wellbeing and explains how to create a supportive environment for young minds. We examine the barriers to children's welfare and the benefits of early intervention for children with disabilities.
courseDescription:
Babies are cute but adults need to understand how children develop to help them reach maturity. ‘Child development’ refers to the process of human growth, from conception and infancy to adulthood. The early years of children's lives are crucial for their long-term health and development. A caring family that provides a safe home in which parents love and spend time with their children can make a big difference to children’s wellbeing and growth.

This childcare course examines the basics of child development and lays out the milestones that mark children's growth. We examine the stages that define age-based child development from birth through infancy and adolescence. We also study the period from when children start coordinating their smiles to when they begin expressing emotions and participating in word games. The course explores some theories of child development, including the constructivist, behaviourist theory and social learning models. 

The course then highlights the external and personal factors that affect child development. We explain how physical transitions affect children and how you can help your child manage the process by building good relationships with people. We study the five aspects of development and show you how to meet a child's special education (SEN) needs. We identify some barriers to child development and establish the significance of early intervention for children with disabilities. This childcare course is useful for parents, guardians, babysitters and other caregivers as it explains how to provide children with nurturing care and better health services. Sign up to learn how to encourage childhood development and use the principles of child psychology to guide young minds towards healthy maturity.
